verses.verse: ((1 The holy Ghost promiseth, that the condition of the Church which was in misery after the captivity of Babylon, should be restored to great excellency.4 So that there should be nothing more comfortable, than to be numbered among the members thereof.) (God laid his foundations among the holy mountains.
The Lord loveth the gates of Zion above all the habitations of Jacob.
(Though thy glorious estate does not yet appear, yet wait with patience, and God will accomplish his promise.) Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

I will make mention of (That is, Egypt and these other countries shall come to the knowledge of God.) Rahab and Babel among them that know me: behold Palestine and Tyre with Ethiopia, (It shall be said of him that is regenerate and come to the Church, that he is as one that was born in the Church.) There is he born.
And of Zion it shall be said, (Out of all quarters they shall come to the Church, and be counted as citizens.) Many are born in her: and he, even the most High shall stablish her.
The Lord shall count, when he (When he calleth by his word them into the Church, whom he had elected and written in the book.) writeth the people, He was born there. Selah.
As well the singers as the players on instruments shall praise thee: all my (The Prophet setteth his whole affections and comfort in the Church.) springs are in thee.
